page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY THURNBY HOUGHT
page.content: Thurnby village is joined to Bushby by a continuous village street(Main St.) running roughly parallel to the the A47 and joining it at both ends. The buildings are a mixture of old and new Some thatched cottages date from the 17th century.The 12th. century church is the focal point.The manor house behind the church is of Jacobean origin. Houghton on the Hill lies on the top of the escarpment and commands a wonderful view to the west and north of the county.The medieval church, with a great spire, can be seen for miles. The main street is comprised of old houses many of which are thatched.The outlying areas are modern housing estates.The village school is now housed in a modern building and caters for about 120 pupils.
